CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1953, pg. 34, reads: "Break Up 'Reefer' Factory - A flourishing 'reefer' factory was put out of business Monday afternoon when Patrolman Richard Edmonds, acting on a tip, informed his superior officer, and a raiding squad hit 1048 Fifth Avenue, and in a second-floor apartment rear nabbed a man and woman and 116 rolled marijuana cigarettes and 1,300 grains of the loose 'junk.' It was one of the biggest hauls ever made by a Centre Avenue raiding squad.  Left to right: patrolman Joseph Parris, Edmonds (standing), Acting Lieut. Ray Adams, and Patrolman Thomas Cusick, who made the raid. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police patrolmen Joseph Parris, Richard Edmonds, Lieutenant Ray Adams, and patrolman Thomas Cusick gathered around desk with marijuana collected from raid, at Centre Avenue police station
